articles.author: Victoria Bisset
articles.title: Rich people's swimming pools are fueling water crises in cities, study says - The Washington Post
articles.description: The study, focused on South Africa's Cape Town, suggested that the wealthiest 14 percent of the population was behind more than half the city's water consumption.
articles.content:
Comment on this story
Comment
Rich elites are fueling water crises by using huge amounts of limited water resources on things like their private swimming pools, irrigating their gardens and washing… [+4746 chars]
